James Matthews

Astrophysicist

Hello!

I’m an astrophysics PhD student studying at the University of Southampton. My research involves using a Monte Carlo radiative transfer code to model accretion disk winds and the spectral features they produce. I am supervised by Professor Christian Knigge. You can find more details on my research, outreach and publications below.

Contact

Projects

Outflows in Accreting Systems

Outflows are ubiquitous in accreting systems. My PhD thesis involved developing a Monte Carlo radiative transfer and photoionization code, and using it to synthesize spectra of accreting objects with associated outflows.

Searching for Exoplanets During Predicted Lensing Events

Outflows are ubiquitous in accreting systems. My PhD thesis involved developing a Monte Carlo radiative transfer and photoionization code, and using it to synthesize spectra of accreting objects with associated outflows.

Outreach

My outreach work involves taking this huge inflatable planetarium into local schools. As you can tell I get pretty excited about this!
